title: One ring away: The players who could cement their legacies with a title this season
content: Great regular seasons don't cement NBA legacies. Great playoff runs do. These six stars -- featuring one MVP and a likely one -- need deep playoff runs to secure their places in the game.

title: Sources: Browns, Giants field trade calls for picks
content: The Browns and Giants are fielding trade inquiries for their early picks in the NFL draft, sources told ESPN.

title: Steelers say Rodgers will not affect draft strategy
content: Aaron Rodgers will not affect the Steelers' draft strategy, but the results of the draft could affect their pursuit of a quarterback.

title: Cincinnati freshman lineman dies; no cause given
content: Cincinnati freshman offensive lineman Jeremiah Kelly, an early enrollee who was participating in spring practice, died unexpectedly at his residence early Tuesday.

title: Biles unsure she'll compete in 2028 LA Olympics
content: Simone Biles, the most decorated gymnast of all time, says she's unsure of whether she'll compete at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics saying, "I've accomplished so much in my sport."

title: Source: Purdy at 49ers' workouts but Kittle is not
content: 49ers quarterback Brock Purdy, who has been discussing a new deal with San Francisco, is in attendance Tuesday for the start of the team's voluntary offseason workout program but tight end George Kittle, who is also seeking a new deal, is not.

title: Ex-NBA ROY Carter-Williams to debut in boxing
content: Former NBA ROY Michael Carter-Williams will make his amateur boxing debut May 29 in New York, facing Sam Khativ in a three-round heavyweight bout.

title: UCLA's Foster goes with 'gut' in getting Iamaleava
content: UCLA's DeShaun Foster said he couldn't pass up a shot to get "the No. 1 player in the portal" in QB Nico Iamaleava. "You just have to go with your gut," Foster said.

title: Silver: Playoff ratings 'fantastic' for first weekend
content: NBA commissioner Adam Silver said Tuesday that television ratings from the opening weekend of the playoffs were the best the league has seen in about a quarter century.

title: Draft Day Predictor settles 10 debates: What numbers say about QB picks, early surprises
content: Which quarterbacks will still be available on Day 2? Could Ashton Jeanty slide to the Bears? And much more.

title: 'Once-in-a-lifetime experience:' How the NFL's smallest market is coming up big to host the draft
content: The Lambeau countdown clock to the draft is running out of days, and the NFL's smallest town is ready.

title: 'Completely separate and at odds': The divisions and chaos that led to the end of the Luka Doncic era in Dallas
content: Doncic's time in Dallas ended with a shocking trade on Feb. 2, but the beginning of the end dates to the summer of 2023.

title: SGA or Jokic? Castle or Risacher? Our experts pick every NBA award
content: Finalists have been unveiled for seven major individual awards, including MVP. Which superstars did our experts' pick?

title: Thanks to Flick and young stars, treble-chasing Barcelona are fun again
content: The financial issues still remain for Barcelona, but they're back to their brilliant best on the pitch as LaLiga, Copa del Rey and Champions League are all still within reach.

title: UEFA give Man City $6m for most int'l call-ups
content: Manchester City were allocated around €5.17 million ($5.94m), the most of any UEFA club, as part of the European football governing body's Club Benefits Programme to encourage national team participation by players.

title: Source: Man Utd eye Wolves, Brazil star Cunha
content: Manchester United are exploring the possibility of triggering the release clause in Matheus Cunha's contract at Wolves, a source has told ESPN.

title: Ex-KC GK Schult: Euro teams don't want moms
content: As an Olympic gold medalist and Champions League winner, Almuth Schult was one of the top goalkeepers in women's soccer. She believes her career ended early because European clubs were reluctant to sign a player with children.

title: Arteta reluctant to rest key players in PL
content: Mikel Arteta has suggested he won't be resting Bukayo Saka for their upcoming Premier League games as they prepare for their Champions League showdown against Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Ancelotti on Madrid future: Anything is possible
content: Carlo Ancelotti insisted that "anything is possible" regarding his future as Real Madrid coach on Tuesday, as the team look to beat Barcelona to a LaLiga and Copa del Rey double.

title: Spurs CB Romero open to move, keen on LaLiga
content: Tottenham Hotspur centre-back Cristian Romero has said he "would love" to play in La Liga one day amid growing speculation over his future.

title: Alonso has 'gentleman's agreement' to exit Bayer
content: Bayer Leverkusen's CEO has said the club has a "gentleman's agreement" with Xabi Alonso that means he could take over at Real Madrid or Liverpool.

title: Wrexham edge closer to promotion with key win
content: Wrexham climbed back into the automatic promotion spots in League 1 with a crucial 2-1 win over Blackpool on Monday.

title: 'Hello, old friend': Randy Orton delivers surprise RKO on John Cena at Raw
content: A day after winning his record 17th WWE title, John Cena ran into a familiar foe on Monday Night Raw.

title: Bullpen stock watch: Devin Williams deserves a little faith
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped, and more.

title: South Carolina up, UCLA down: How the transfer portal impacts the women's Way-Too-Early Top 25﻿
content: Big transfers have put South Carolina at No. 1 and propelled the likes of LSU, Oklahoma and Tennessee higher.

title: Rankings, projections, strategy and cheat sheets
content: Rankings, projections, player profiles, draft strategies -- we've got everything you need to dominate your fantasy women's basketball draft from every angle.

title: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025 WNBA season
content: Which players will exceed fantasy expectations? Who will disappoint? And who is ready to reach an elite level?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye River Plate star Mastantuono
content: Manchester United are considering a move for emerging River Plate star Franco Mastantuono. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 'I found your dad': The mystery of a missing climber
content: Bill Stampfl vanished climbing Peru's highest mountain 22 years ago. This is the story of the hiker who found him and brought closure to Stampfl's family.

title: Chris Eubank Jr. vs Conor Benn: How to watch, ring walk time, undercard
content: Chris Eubank Jr. and Conor Benn will face each other in London on Saturday. Here is everything you need to know ahead of the highly anticipated bout.

title: "US Stands Strong With India Against Terror": Trump On Attack In Pahalgam
content: The United States stands strong with India, underlined US President Donald Trump, sending a message of solidarity with India as a terror attack targeting tourists killed 26 in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: 26 Killed In J&K's Worst Terror Attack In Recent Times: Sources
content: Twenty-six tourists were killed and several others were injured in a terrorist attack in Pahalgam today, in the worst terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir in recent times.

title: Businessman From Chhattisgarh's Raipur Killed In Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: A Raipur-based businessman was killed in a terror attack in Kashmir's Pahalgam town on Tuesday, officials said.

title: Belgium Court Rejects Mehul Choksi's Bail Plea
content: A Belgian court has declined the bail plea of Mehul Choksi, a key accused in the Rs 13,500 crore Punjab National Bank (PNB) loan fraud case.

title: "Brutal Crime, Has No Justification": Vladimir Putin On Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Russian president Vladimir Putin reached out to President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi this evening, expressing condolences for the deaths in the massive terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Another Karnataka Resident Killed In Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Another person from Karnataka was killed in Pahalgam terror attack on Tuesday, taking the toll from the state to two.

title: After Harvard, 100 US Colleges Unite Against Trump's Crackdown On Education
content: The storm that was brewing over the targeting of migrant students in the United States has taken a sharp upswing. More than 100 universities and colleges, including the elite Ivy League institutions, have come together to take on the US government.

title: Kashmir Terror Attack Updates: Amit Shah Reaches Srinagar, Navy Officer Among 26 Killed
content: Kashmir terror attack live updates: At least 26 civilians, mostly tourists, were killed in a terror attack in Pahalgam in Jammu & Kashmir's Anantnag district on Tuesday, sources said, in what is the deadliest attack in the Valley since 2019.

title: "Didn't Look Back": Maharashtra Couple Who Escaped J&K Terror Attack
content: A difference of 20 minutes. That's what saved them, says the family from Maharashtra who survived the terror attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that claimed 26 lives, the worst attack on civilians in years.

title: Trump Tariffs Have Increased Financial Stability Risks, Says Global Body
content: US President Donald Trump's stop-start tariff rollout has "significantly" increased global financial stability risks, the International Monetary Fund said in a report published Tuesday.

title: Major Terror Attacks In Jammu And Kashmir Since 2000
content: The attack on Tuesday that killed 26 people in Pahalgam is the biggest one targeting tourists this year, and comes amid the government's resolve to end terrorism in the Union Territory. Union Home Minister Amit Shah, ahead of leaving for Srinagar th

title: On Camera, Tourists' Horror In Pahalgam: "A Man Came And Shot My Husband"
content: "Please save my husband," a woman's bone-chilling wails echoed through the picturesque valley of Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam after terrorists opened fire at tourists today.

title: At Least 2 From Pune Killed In J&K's Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: At least two persons from Pune have suffered gunshot injuries in a terrorist attack in Kashmir, with NCP (SP) MP Supriya Sule requesting Chief Minister Omar Abdullah to provide immediate medical aid and support.

title: "Thoughts, Prayers": JD Vance, On India Visit, Condoles Deaths In J&K Attack
content: US Vice President JD Vance extends condolences after J&K terror attack, says "thoughts and prayers" are with people of India.

title: Gold Prices Soar Amid Market Turbulence, Cross Rs 1 Lakh Per 10 Grams
content: Gold prices have crossed Rs 1 lakh for 10 grams in India as the yellow metal witnesses a record rally driven by uncertainties in global markets.

title: Pune Porsche Crash: Mother Of Accused Teen Granted Bail In Blood Swapping Case
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday granted interim bail to the mother of the teenage accused in the Pune Porsche crash case, which resulted in the death of two software engineers after a speeding car collided with their motorbike.

title: International Monetary Fund Slashes Growth Outlook On Impact Of US Tariffs
content: Given the stop-start nature to Trump's tariff rollout, the IMF introduced a cutoff date of April 4, meaning they do not include the administration's latest salvos, which have hiked the level of new levies against China to 145 percent.

title: $5,000, Scholarships, Medals: Why Trump Is Pushing Women To Have More Babies
content: At the heart of this initiative are proposals aimed at incentivising marriage and childbirth, signaling a significant shift towards making family growth a national priority.

title: PM Dials Amit Shah After Terror Attack, Home Minister Reaches Srinagar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is in Saudi Arabia, dialled Home Minister Amit Shahsoon after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalagam that claimed a tourist's life.

title: Gold Hits Record, Stocks Diverge As Trump Fuels Fed Fears
content: Gold reached $3,500 an ounce for the first time Tuesday as US President Donald Trump's tariffs and verbal assault on the Federal Reserve prompted investors to snap up the safe-haven asset.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: 26 killed, including foreigners, locals & navy officer
content: A suspected terrorist attack occurred in Pahalgam's Baisaran Valley. Several tourists sustained injuries. Gunshots were heard, prompting security forces to respond. BJP leader Ravinder Raina blamed Pakistani terrorists. Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti condemned the attack. She called for a thorough investigation and security improvements. Authorities have cordoned off the area to investigate the incident.

title: KL Rahul haunts old team as DC crush Rishabh Pant's LSG
content: Delhi Capitals secured a dominant eight-wicket victory against Lucknow Super Giants, propelled by KL Rahul's unbeaten 57 and Abishek Porel's explosive 51. Rahul reached a milestone, becoming the fastest Indian to 5000 IPL runs. Mukesh Kumar's impressive 4/34 restricted LSG to 159/6, setting the stage for DC's comfortable chase and solidifying their second position on the points table.

title: From Amarnath to Pahalgam: Major civilian terror strikes in J&K since 2000
content: On April 22, a terrorist attack in Anantnag district's Pahalgam area killed 26 people, including tourists and security personnel. The assault, which occurred near the Baisaran Valley, claimed the life of an Indian Navy officer and two foreign nationals. This incident is the latest in a series of attacks targeting civilians and security forces in Kashmir since 2000.

title: 'US stands strong with India': Trump pledges 'full support' after 26 killed in J&K
content: Following the deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that claimed the lives of at least 26 people, mostly tourists, US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin strongly condemned the violence and assured India of their support in fighting terrorism.

title: Microsoft’s chief HR to managers: This isn't just about Microsoft's success...
content: Microsoft is implementing stricter performance management policies, including a two-year rehire ban for underperformers and restrictions on internal transfers. These changes aim to accelerate high performance and swiftly address low performance, aligning with industry trends toward performance-based evaluations. The company is also introducing AI-supported tools to aid managers in performance conversations.

title: KL Rahul gets his redemption in Lucknow with massive IPL milestone
content: KL Rahul achieved a significant milestone, reaching 5000 IPL runs in a record 130 innings, as Delhi Capitals secured a dominant 8-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Rahul's unbeaten 57, along with Abishek Porel's fifty, guided DC to chase down the target of 160 with ease. Mukesh Kumar's impressive 4/33 helped restrict LSG to a below-par total.

title: 'Numb disbelief': Cricketers condemn Pahalgam terror attack
content: Following the deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Kashmir, which claimed 26 lives, Indian cricketers - past and present - Shubman Gill, Gautam Gambhir, Parthiv Patel, and Aakash Chopra condemned the violence. Gambhir asserted that those responsible would face consequences. Union Home Minister Amit Shah, along with Lt Governor Manoj Sinha, visited Srinagar to assess the situation and meet with officials and victims.

title: Trump Tariffs: Amazon CEO makes a 'promise', says that I understand why, I mean ...
content: Amidst escalating tariffs imposed by the Trump administration, Amazon is navigating challenges to shield consumers from rising costs. CEO Andy Jassy acknowledges the strain on businesses, anticipating price increases from third-party sellers. Amazon is strategically mitigating impact through bulk purchases and renegotiated contracts, while observing early signs of consumer stockpiling in response to expected price hikes.

title: What is The Resistance Front? TRF claims responsibility for J&K attack
content: The Resistance Front (TRF), a proxy for Lashkar-e-Taiba, claimed responsibility for the Pahalgam attack that killed 26 tourists. This banned group recruits youth online for terrorist activities and is supported by Pakistani intelligence. Following the deadly attack, Union Home Minister Amit Shah arrived in Srinagar to assess the security situation and will chair a high-level meeting with security officials.

title: Mark Zuckerberg, JP Morgan CEO & others sold billions in stock before Trump Tariffs
content: Before President Trump's tariff announcement triggered a market crash, Meta's Mark Zuckerberg, JP Morgan Chase's Jamie Dimon, and Oracle's Safra Catz sold significant amounts of stock. These sales, totaling billions, occurred just before the market downturn, raising questions about potential insider knowledge. While the market plummeted, some billionaires saw it as a buying opportunity.

title: Forced to climb down 30-foot well, women in this Nashik Village risk lives
content: Residents of Borichibari village in Nashik face a severe water crisis, forcing women to risk climbing down a well for water. Despite claims of water supply by the gram panchayat, villagers report otherwise. A viral video shows a woman descending into a well, prompting an official inspection.

title: 'I regret playing cricket': Former India captain drops bombshell
content: Mohammad Azharuddin has voiced his profound disappointment after the HCA Ombudsman ordered the removal of his name from the North Stand at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. He expressed feeling heartbroken and described the situation as a complete disgrace to the sport, further alleging corruption within the HCA led to him being barred from contesting elections.

title: Royals match-fixing allegation: Battle for IPL tickets takes centre-stage
content: Rajasthan Royals have strongly refuted match-fixing allegations made by Rajasthan Cricket Association ad-hoc committee convener Jaydeep Bihani, labelling them as baseless and defamatory. The franchise asserts that Bihani's claims undermine the team, the BCCI, and the integrity of cricket. A BCCI official dismissed the allegations, suggesting they stem from upcoming RCA elections.

title: UPSC Civil Services 2024: Pune's Archit Dongre achieves AIR 3
content: Archit Parag Dongre from Pune has achieved All India Rank 3 in the UPSC Civil Services Examination 2024, making him Maharashtra's top performer. The UPSC announced the final results on April 22, 2025, recommending 1,009 candidates for various services. Dongre, an engineering graduate from VIT, previously secured AIR 153 in 2023.

title: Pope Francis death: The curious connection between World Wars and papal deaths
content: But here’s the thing: timing is not causality. The idea that papal deaths somehow signal or foreshadow world wars is compelling as a narrative—especially in a social media age where historical trivia morphs easily into eschatological prophecy. But it falls into a classic logical trap: post hoc ergo propter hoc—after this, therefore because of this.

title: 'KL Rahul to replace Rishabh Pant in 2026 T20 World Cup'
content: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts changes for India's 2026 T20 World Cup team. KL Rahul may replace Rishabh Pant. Abhishek Sharma and Shubman Gill could step in for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. Shreyas Iyer might replace Shivam Dube. Vipraj Nigam is a long-term prospect for Ravindra Jadeja. Mayank Yadav could partner with Arshdeep Singh.

title: Shocking! Rs 27 crore buy Rishabh Pant achieves another low for LSG
content: In a surprising move, Rishabh Pant batted at No. 7 for Delhi Capitals against Lucknow Super Giants, a rare occurrence after 113 IPL innings. Unfortunately, he was dismissed for a golden duck by Mukesh Kumar, who starred with 3 for 34. Pant’s struggles with the bat have been a recurring concern this season.

title: People wail for help as loved ones lie in pools of blood: Pahalgam attack
content: Pahalgam in South Kashmir experienced a terror attack. Terrorists attacked a tourist spot in Baisaran Valley. The attack resulted in at least 20 injuries. Security forces and locals assisted in rescue operations. Authorities are investigating the incident. Top officials condemned the attack, and assured that the perpetrators will face consequences.

title: 'Unacceptable': SC Bar Association condemns BJP's Dubey's 'civil war' remark
content: The Supreme Court Bar Association (SCBA) has strongly condemned BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's remarks criticizing the Supreme Court and CJI Sanjiv Khanna regarding the Waqf law. The SCBA seeks contempt proceedings against Dubey, urging the Attorney General's consent. The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a plea for contempt, addressing Dubey's accusations of judicial overreach and undermining constitutional structures.

title: Pahalgam attack: 24/7 emergency helpline launched- what we know so far
content: Following the deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, J&K, which claimed 26 lives, authorities have launched a 24/7 emergency helpline for tourists. Union home minister Amit Shah and CM Omar Abdullah are en route to assess the situation. PM Modi, currently in Saudi Arabia, condemned the attack and assured justice, instructing Shah to take necessary actions.

title: 'Blinded by lights': Man files case against himself after daughter dies in accident
content: In a rare turn of events, Pappu Yogi filed a police complaint against himself after a tragic accident near Prantij toll plaza claimed the life of his eight-year-old daughter, Priyanka. Yogi, while driving his family from Mumbai to their village in Rajasthan, lost control of the car due to blinding lights, resulting in the fatal incident.

title: Why did revenue officials visit Usha Vance’s 96-year-old grandmother in Vizag?
content: The visit of US Vice-President J.D. Vance and Second Lady Usha Vance to India sparked emotional responses in Andhra Pradesh, where Usha’s ancestral roots lie. Her traditional gestures and family ties stirred local pride, prompting official inquiries and heartfelt appeals from relatives and villagers hoping for a visit. Usha’s lineage traces back to Andhra’s scholarly Chilukuri family.

title: Meet Harshita Goyal: Second highest scorer of UPSC 2024
content: Harshita Goyal, securing All India Rank 2 in the UPSC Civil Services Examination 2024, exemplifies dedication and a desire to serve. A Chartered Accountant from MS University of Baroda, she aims to impact grassroots levels, drawing from her involvement with the Gujarat Youth Parliament and the Believe Foundation. Her focus includes women's empowerment, envisioning equal access to opportunities.

title: Kash Patel's frequent use of govt jets has tongues wagging about personal travel decisions
content: FBI Director Kash Patel has been under scrutiny for his frequent use of government planes for personal travel, including high-profile sporting events and trips to his girlfriend's hometown. The timing and nature of these trips raise questions about the balance between professional duty and personal convenience. Critics argue that the government's air travel policy, which requires employees to pay the government back at a lower rate than private planes, may not be being used wisely.

title: From Shraddha Walkar to Saurabh Rajput: Why Indian couples are killing each other
content: A disturbing trend of intimate-partner homicides in India reveals a deadly mix of patriarchy, financial strain, infidelity, substance abuse, and mental health issues. Legal delays and societal norms exacerbate the problem, trapping victims and enabling perpetrators. Urgent systemic change, gender-neutral laws, and accessible counseling are crucial to address this silent epidemic and protect vulnerable individuals.

title: Former cricketer questions BCCI's double standards in Kohli case
content: Aakash Chopra has questioned the BCCI's apparent double standard, pointing out that Virat Kohli escaped punishment for his aggressive celebration directed at Shreyas Iyer, while Digvesh Rathi was fined twice for his notebook celebration. Chopra also recalled MS Dhoni being fined for arguing with umpires, suggesting Kohli received preferential treatment.

title: 'Spreading misinformation ... ' EC slams Rahul's claims on Maha polls
content: The Election Commission refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of abnormal voter turnout in the final hours of the Maharashtra assembly elections, deeming his allegations against the electoral rolls an affront to the rule of law. EC sources emphasized that Congress representatives didn't raise concerns during scrutiny.

title: Trump impact: IMF cuts India's GDP growth forecast to 6.2%
content: The IMF's April 2025 World Economic Outlook revised India's 2025 GDP growth to 6.2%, down from the previously projected 6.5%, due to increased trade tensions and global uncertainty stemming from US tariff policies.

title: Watch: Saudi singer welcomes PM Modi to Jeddah with 'Ae Watan' song
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a grand welcome in Jeddah, marked by a soulful rendition of 'Ae Watan' by a Saudi singer and a Royal Saudi Air Force escort. A 21-gun salute further underscored the visit's importance.

title: Why Trump wants to fire Pete Hegseth
content: If the first leak was a lapse, the second looks like a pattern. And patterns — especially those that risk lives — are rarely tolerated long in Washington, even in a Trump-led administration where loyalty often trumps protocol.

title: 'If a hot girl texts you ... ': Musk mocks crypto scams in viral X post
content: Elon Musk cautioned against cryptocurrency scams on X with a viral image, highlighting scammers' use of fake profiles, often posing as attractive women, to lure victims. The post underscores that these messages, despite appearances, are frequently sent by male scammers. Musk's warning addresses the serious issue of crypto-related fraud on social media, where scammers exploit users for financial gain.

title: Man who told Bengaluru driver to 'speak Hindi' apologises in Kannada
content: A video showing a man demanding an auto driver speak Hindi in Bengaluru sparked a language debate. The man, dubbed the 'Hindi warrior,' later apologized in Kannada, claiming he didn't intend to offend and regretted his outburst.

title: 'Our kids just like him, food was too good': Vance on visit to PM Modi's home
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited Prime Minister Narendra Modi's residence in New Delhi. Vance shared his positive experience, highlighting the Prime Minister's hospitality and its impact on his children, with his eldest son even expressing a desire to live in India.

title: Australia reacts to reports of banning visa of Indians from 'specific states'
content: Australia has refuted claims that it's restricting student visa applications from Indian states like Punjab and Gujarat. The Australian High Commission in New Delhi clarified that no such ban exists, emphasizing the strong educational ties between the two nations. Over 125,000 Indian students are currently studying in Australia, highlighting their significant contribution.

title: 'Shocked beyond belief': CM Omar Abdullah condemns Palgham terror attack
content: In a shocking incident, terrorists opened fire on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag district, specifically in the Baisaran Valley area of Pahalgam, injuring several. Security forces swiftly responded to the attack in the remote area, often called 'mini-Switzerland'. Injured tourists were admitted to a local hospital, with some evacuated by helicopter.

title: Farewell to Pope Francis: List of world leaders attending Saturday's funeral
content: Pope Francis, the first Latin American pontiff, will be laid to rest on Saturday in St Peter’s Square, concluding his 12-year papacy. World leaders, including US President Trump and UK Prime Minister Starmer, will attend. He will lie in state for three days, and his wish was to be buried at the Basilica of St Mary Major.

title: PM Modi's approval rating makes me jealous: JD Vance - Top quotes
content: US Vice President JD Vance, during his visit to India, lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi's popularity, expressing envy over his approval ratings. He further emphasised that, "We're not here to preach that you do things any one particular way. Too often in the past, Washington approached Prime Minister Modi with an attitude of preaching."

title: Amid Waqf row, Owaisi's 'Ya-Habibi' jibe at PM Modi's Saudi visit
content: Asaduddin Owaisi has criticized the new Waqf law. He also commented on Narendra Modi's Saudi Arabia visit. Owaisi suggested Modi ask the Crown Prince about Medina's land status. He defended Waqf's presence in Muslim countries. Owaisi addressed the separation of powers. He said the judiciary will intervene if the government misuses power.

title: Beware! Delhi vehicles without fuel stickers to be fined: How to apply online
content: Delhi vehicle owners, take note! The Transport Department warns that lacking a fuel-based colour-coded sticker could result in a fine. This initiative, mandated by the Supreme Court and part of pollution control efforts, requires all vehicles in Delhi to display these chromium-based hologram stickers. These stickers help authorities quickly identify fuel types.

title: Clippers bounce back as Kawhi outduels Jokic; can the Lakers, Grizz follow suit?
content: no. 4 Denver Nuggets and no. 5 LA Clippers played another close thriller . the series now heads to Intuit Dome for the first playoff games to play at the NBA's newest arena . here's what matters most and what to watch in all four series .

title: Ranking the top 10 defensive backs in college football
content: Ohio State's Caleb Downs is the best defensive back in college football in 2025 . he was targeted 14 times last season and allowed 2.1 yards per attempt . our college football reporters were asked to select the top 10 defensive backs .

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: The Battle of Florida finally begins!
content: seven of eight first-round series in the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs have begun . the battle of Florida between the Tampa Bay Lightning and Florida Panthers begins anew ( 8:30 p.m. ET, ESPN ). who are the key players to watch? read on for game previews with statistical insights from ESPN Research .

title: Our college softball rankings after Week 11: Top 25 poll, plus what to watch
content: the Lady Vols are coming off a series sweep over Auburn and ride into week 12 on a five-game win streak . Oregon has jumped one spot to no. 5 after taking two games against UCLA . this week's top 25 ranking includes who and what to watch .

title: College baseball Week 10: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: we're getting down to crunch time for some teams to prove themselves . the biggest riser was Vanderbilt, which jumped up 10 spots after sweeping Georgia . Ole Miss dropped 12 spots to no. 23 in the ranking this week after losing a road series to south Carolina .

title: NBA playoff odds; Thunder, Celtics heavily favored to play for NBA championship
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers , Denver Nuggets and Minnesota Timberwolves all have better odds than the second-seed Houston Rockets . despite their game 1 win, the Timberwolves are still well behind the lakers in the odds .

title: Pistons snap historic 15-game playoff drought as Towns has quiet night for Knicks
content: the 2025 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the Finals . the two other East series -- the no. 1 Cleveland Cavaliers vs. the No. 8 Miami Heat, and the . no. 2 Boston Celtics, will pick back up Wednesday .

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Hurricanes new favorites following Avalanche Game 2 loss
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs have begun with 16 teams looking to be the last one standing after four rounds of playoff hockey . the Toronto Maple Leafs will look to snap the longest championship drought in NHL history . they will have to contend with their cross-state rivals, the Ottawa Senators .

title: Tightest title races: Serie A playoff? 6 potential champions?
content: a lot of titles are already a foregone conclusion in most countries in Europe . there are also a few leagues across Europe, and even elsewhere in England . the most high-profile title race that is reaching boiling point is Italy's Serie A .

title: BJP takes dig at Congress ‘inability’ to choose Leader of Opposition in Haryana
content: Taking a dig at the Congress party, the BJP said that the Congress Party has lost its ability to make decisions

title: India aims to double share of manufacturing in GDP to 23% helped by sunrise sectors: FM
content: For India, she said, ‘scaling up manufacturing is essential to absorb a youthful workforce, reduce import dependencies and build competitive global supply chains’

title: Reschedule work hours to mitigate effect of extreme heatwaves, Centre tells States
content: Along with special attention for construction and brick kiln workers, the Labour Ministry has recommended adequate drinking water facilities, ventilation and cooling, rest areas, and health check-ups

title: How a previous attempt in Tamil Nadu to study Centre-State relations panned out
content:
The DMK government, led by M.K. Stalin, has recently constituted a committee on the subject. Over 50 years ago, the report of the Rajamannar Committee, constituted by the M. 
Karunanidhi-led DMK government in September 1969, came out in May 1971 and ran into criticism from different parties, some of which are now allies of the DMK

title: Hindi as third language no longer ‘mandatory‘ from Class 1 in Maharashtra schools: Education Minister
content: The Minister explained that while Hindi will not be mandatory, students should study a third language from Class 1 as per their choice

title:
A modest menagerie to a sprawling refuge for wildlife — the story of 
Vandalur Zoo
content: In 1855, Edward Balfour, Director of the Government Central Museum in Madras, proposed a collection of live animals for public display on the museum premises. In 1861, the government relocated the animals to the People’s Park near Central Station. Limited space and pollution from the nearby industries forced the shift to Vandalur

title: EU’s far-right vs judiciary conflict
content: Certain far-right political figures in the European Union have been subjects of recent high-profile court cases that did not end in their favour, giving rise to accusations of political persecution and some deep contentions about judicial independence

title: Kiren Rijiju slams Mamata Banerjee for ‘refusing to implement’ Waqf Act
content: The  Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs said the West Bengal CM’s ‘misguided remarks on the Waqf Act’ had ‘led to the violence in Murshidabad’

title: ED briefs Delhi court on U.K. court denying Sanjay Bhandari’s extradition to India
content: Bhandari, a defence consultant, wanted on charges of tax evasion and money laundering, has cited the “unsafe conditions” in the Tihar Jail in Delhi

title: A.P. Govt. committed to development of Children with Special Needs, says official
content: Autism centres planned in 125 municipalities in State to provide skill development, specialised training, announces Director of School Education V. Vijay Rama Raju

title: Bill on simultaneous polls unconstitutional: A.M. Singhvi
content: The Congress MP tells parliamentary committee that the Bill seeks to subordinate State election cycle to the parliamentary elections, which is a violation of the federal principle and thereby basic structure of Constitution

title: South Western Railway rolls out Indian Railways’ first Converged Communication System
content: The new AI-driven CCTV system uses machine learning algorithms to track live footage and detect specific events such as unusual motion, lighting changes, colour patterns (e.g., a person in a red shirt), and even potentially dangerous scenarios such as loitering or a person collapsing.

title: Kerala government tasks special team to ensure safety of Keralites in Jammu and Kashmir
content: Those requiring help or information should call the NoRKA helpline number 18004253939 or give a missed call to 00918802012345

title: Fruit vendor murder case solved, four arrested
content: Shaik Sadiq Valli’s murder solved as Kadapa police arrest four accused in Ramarajupalle over past rivalry

title: 77 apartment owners in Chander Kunj Army Towers opt for buy-back
content: The decision was conveyed at a meeting of the district committee, chaired by the Collector; a tentative schedule drawn up to shift residents by June 30 and complete the demolition within four months thereafter

title: SC sub-classification paves way for APPSC’s pending recruitments
content: Commission likely to release 18 notifications soon pertaining to 866 vacant posts in various government departments

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Narrow escape for three Kerala High Court judges
content: The judges, Anil K. Narendran, G. Girish and P. G. Ajithkumar and their families were on a vacation to Jammu and Kashmir when terrorists struck

title: Day after Rahul Gandhi’s attack, ECI says Indian election process is acclaimed across the world
content: Misinformation maligns all elected representatives, demotivates poll staff, disrespects law, says ECI; rebuts Congress claims on Maharashtra discrepancies

title: CID police grill former Intelligence chief P.S.R. Anjaneyulu in actress ‘harassment’ case
content: The suspended IPS officer was taken into custody from his home in Hyderabad and shifted to CID office in Vijayawada for questioning

title: Pahalgam terror attack: J&K parties, tourism players condemn deadly attack; Congress seeks ‘accountability instead of hollow claims’
content: Former J&K Chief Minister and Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) president Mehbooba Mufti said such violence was unacceptable and must be denounced

title: Student’s death: police find no evidence of ragging
content: The inquiry was limited to the allegation of ragging, while the rest of the investigation is being carried out by the Hill Palace police under the Kochi City police

title: Sandbar at Muthalapozhi to be removed urgently; Ministers see bid to create tension in the region
content: Ministers V. Sivankutty and G.R. Anil accuse a section in the region of indulging in a conspiracy to deliberately create tension in the fishing hamlet

title: Devotees circumambulate seven hills of Tirumala
content: The 300 km spiritual yatra circumambulating Tirumala hills ended with Harathi at Kapila Theertham in Tirupati

title: Minister expresses concern over meat being cut and sold near Hampi heritage site
content: H.K. Patil confirms that FIRs have already been registered against three individuals in Anegundi in connection with the incident

title: Thampu launches Ooru Kappu yatra to bridge gap between tribespeople and govt. schemes
content: Yatra begins from Kurukkathikallu tribal hamlet explains in detail various government programmes to tribal people in their language

title: CPI(M) will stage a comeback; Bengal to play vital role: M.A. Baby
content: “We are trying to learn from the people; we are listening to the criticism of the people,” says CPI(M) general secretary

title: A look back at major terror attacks on civilians in J&K since 2000
content: Multiple tourists were killed and at least 20 were injured on April 22, 2025 when terrorists opened fire in a picturesque meadow near Kashmir’s Pahalgam town

title: Keralites shine in Civil Services Examination
content: At least six candidates from the State have secured spots in the top 100 ranks, while at least 24 aspirants figure in the top 500

title: Amaravati gearing up for PM Modi’s visit to relaunch capital works on May 2
content: Event to be held on a 250-acre site behind Secretariat; basic amenities, adequate parking areas and lighting on all important roads leading to Amaravati being arranged in anticipation of a turnout of about 5 lakh people from across the State

title: BRS demands CM’s apology, and action on police involved in  Lagcherla incident
content: KTR says the BRS would move the Supreme Court again if the State government fails to act on NHRC report and take action against police officers involved in harassment, rights violation

title: Rahul Gandhi’s remarks on EC aimed at diverting attention from National Herald case: BJP
content: BJP national spokesperson Nalin Kohli questions the ‘silence’ of the senior leadership of the Congress on charges levelled by the ED

title: Sonnet Jose’s achievement is a childhood dream
content: Sonnet Jose secures the 54th rank in the civil services examination 2024. She is the second person from Kottayam-Idukki bordering region to clear the exam, after incumbent Thrissur Collector Arjun Pandiyan

title: Madras High Court orders enhancement of pay offered to 8,573 contract nurses in Tamil Nadu
content: Justices R. Subramanian and P.T. Asha direct the government to do so within three months or end up facing contempt proceedings once again

title: Limitation clause sparks concern even as second Waqf survey details are yet to be notified in Telangana
content: The limitation clause would enable encroachers to remain in possession of waqf  land, say members of the All India Muslim Personal Law Board

title: Delhi High Court posts M.J. Akbar’s plea against Priya Ramani for September 19
content: The former Union Minister has filed an appeal challenging the acquittal of journalist Priya Ramani in a criminal defamation case over her accusations of sexual harassment against him

title: Minister assures support, fair price to tobacco farmers
content: Minister Bala Veeranjaneya Swamy assures support to tobacco farmers facing issues with low bids and delayed procurement in Ongole
